definitions: To stain or cover with blood.
To initiate someone into a particular activity or experience, especially one involving violence or hardship.
To give an animal its first taste of blood, especially in hunting.
To let blood from; to bleed (an animal or person).
examples: The hunter will blood the hounds.
He was blooded in his first combat.
The surgeon will blood the patient to reduce pressure.
The new recruits were blooded in the harsh training.
